Hi, My Name is Nick Geary

Engineer | Developer | Problem Solver

About Me

What am I about

My name is Nicholas Geary and I am a problem solver. Being able to adapt, is how I've found success. I have experience in a variety of fields including engineering, web development, and manufacturing.

I started my career in manufacturing which led me to earning an associates degree in Computer Aided Design and Drafting from Erie Community College and a bachelor's degree in Industrial and Systems Engineering from the University at Buffalo. These have led me to careers in industries such as textiles, metal fabrication, and healthcare.

Recently I've found myself interested in the world of web development and data science. Using my ability to adapt, I am always on the lookout to find new technologies and tools to help me solve the problems infront of me.

My Work

Check out some of my projects...

NHL 321 Point System

Frontend Tools: HTML5, Bootstrap4, & CSS3

Backend Tools: Python, BeautifulSoup , NumPy, & Pandas

TLDR: This project is to take a look to see what the NHL's standings would be if they went to a 3-2-1 point system.

Beta Version 2 uses the same idea as the orginial but upgrading the technology to the MERN Stack. MERN stands for MongoDB, Express.js, React/Redux, & Node.js.

Live Demo Github Beta Version 2

Burger Builder

Frontend Tools: HTML5, CSS3, React, Redux, & React Router

Backend Tools: Firebase

TLDR: The goal was to create a dynamic burger building webapp complete with pricing and check out page.

Github

Basic Weather App

Tools: React & the OpenWeatherMap API

TLDR: Basic weather app using the OpenWeatherMap open API.

Github Live Demo
